summary: Glycyrrhetinic acid (GA) is the most important ingredient in licorice due to its outstanding anti-inflammatory activity and wide application in the medicine and cosmetics industries. GA was produced through metabolically engineering Saccharomyces cerevisiae by introducing the entire heterogeneous biosynthetic pathway of GA. the metabolically engineered yeast cell factories provide an alternative approach to glycyrrhetinic acid production. electronic supplementary material The online version of this article contains supplementary material, which is available to authorized users.
